claim.claim-text: A method, performed by a wireless network system associated with a wireless network, for providing upstream communications from an electronic device to the wireless network, the method comprising: identifying a set of carriers that may be used together without causing an intermodulation product that falls within one or more active pass-bands associated with a receiver of the electronic device; and scheduling a carrier aggregated upstream communication from the electronic device to the wireless network using the identified set of carriers, the carrier aggregated upstream communication being an orthogonal frequency division multiplexing communication.

The method of claim 1, wherein identifying a set of carriers that may be used together without causing an intermodulation product that falls within the one or more active pass-bands comprises: selecting a plurality of carriers, at least two of the carriers being from different bands; and determining whether the selected carriers create an intermodulation product that falls within the one or more active pass-bands.

The method of claim 2, wherein determining whether the carriers create an intermodulation product that falls within the one or more active pass-bands comprises: calculating a third order intermodulation product based on two or three selected carriers; and determining whether the third order intermodulation product falls within the one or more active pass-bands.

The method of any one of claims 2 or 3, wherein the one or more active pass-bands represent receiver channels corresponding to transmitter channels in use for transmissions using the selected set of carriers.

The method of any one of claims 2 to 4, further comprising, prior to determining whether the -carriers create an intermodulation product that falls within the one or more active pass-bands: determining, with reference to band intermodulation product information stored in memory, that the selected carriers are included in bands that may be associated with a problematic intermodulation product when used together for carrier aggregation.

The method of any one of claims 1 to 5, wherein identifying a set of carriers that may be used together without causing an intermodulation product that falls within one or more active pass-bands associated with a receiver of the electronic device comprises: selecting a plurality of carriers, at least two of the selected carriers being from different bands; and determining, with reference to band intermodulation product information stored in memory, that the selected carriers are included in bands that are not associated with a problematic intermodulation product when used together for carrier aggregation.
The method of claim 7, wherein the steps of calculating, determining, categorizing and storing are performed for each pair of upstream carriers that consists of one upstream carrier from each band.

The method of any one of claims 7 or 8, wherein identifying a set of carriers that may be used together without causing an intermodulation product that falls within one or more active pass-bands associated with a receiver of the electronic device comprises: using the categorization information to identify an intermodulation-friendly carrier pair.

The method of any one of claims 7 to 9, wherein selecting two bands comprises: selecting, with reference to band intermodulation product information stored in memory, two bands that may be associated with an intermodulation product when used together for carrier aggregation.
The method of claim 10, wherein the selected bands are LTE bands 7 and 20.
The method of claim 10, wherein the selected bands are LTE bands 4 and 17.

The method of any one of claims 1 to 12, wherein identifying a set of carriers that may be used together without causing an intermodulation product that falls within one or more active pass-bands associated with a receiver of the electronic device comprises retrieving categorization information from memory, the categorization information indicating whether a pair of upstream carriers associated with a plurality of bands may be used together without causing an intermodulation product that falls within one or more active pass-bands associated with a receiver of the electronic device.

The method of any one of claims 1 to 13, where scheduling a carrier aggregated upstream communication from the electronic device to the wireless network using the identified set of carriers comprises generating a schedule in which the electronic device is scheduled to use all of the identified carriers at the same time for upstream carrier aggregation, and wherein the schedule also allows a downstream signal to be transmitted to that electronic device during that same time.

The method of any one of claims 1 to 14, further comprising: identifying a set of IMD unfriendly carriers, the set of IMD unfriendly carriers including carriers that cause an intermodulation product that falls within one or more active pass-bands associated with a receiver of the electronic device when all carriers in the set are used together for upstream carrier aggregation; and scheduling an upstream communication to the wireless network by generating a schedule in which all carriers in the set of IMD unfriendly carriers are used by a single electronic device carriers during a common time slot for the upstream communication but in which the electronic device is scheduled to turn off its receiver during that time slot.

The method of any one of claims 1 to 14, further comprising: identifying a set of IMD unfriendly carriers, the set of IMD unfriendly carriers including carriers that cause an intermodulation product that falls within one or more active pass-bands associated with a receiver of the electronic device when all carriers in the set are used together for upstream carrier aggregation; and scheduling an upstream communication to the wireless network by generating a schedule in which a single electronic device uses all carriers in the set of IMD unfriendly carriers during a time slot but in which no downstream communications are scheduled to that electronic device during the time slot.

A node for providing communications within a wireless network, the node comprising: a scheduler configured to determine a schedule for using resources associated with the wireless network, the scheduler being configured to perform the method of any one of claims 1 to 17
